comments:
Build ID: 3.3RC3

Steps To Reproduce:
in Linux ia23
TPTP build: 4.4.0-200706070100
1.Stop or don't run AC (IAC should work)
2.Open profile dialog
3.Select "Java application" profiling
4.create new profile
5.go to monitoring page and click "Test connection" for "Java profiling - JRE 1.5 or newer".

Message appears:
"The JVMTI agent org.eclipse.tptp.jvmti is not available. Make sure that the library for the agent are available and that it is configured properly."














More information:
IAC should start in this case.

In pages "External Java Application" and 
"Attach to agent" "Test connection"  works fine.

Exception from Eclipse:
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.exceptions.TimeoutException: Launching Process command timed out.
        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.queryAgentByProcessID(AgentController.java:504)
        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.getAgent(AgentController.java:858)

        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.TIDelegateHelper.attachToAgent(TIDelegateHelper.java:624)

        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.TIDelegateHelper$2.processLaunched(TIDelegateHelper.java:447)
        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ProcessImpl.launchAC(ProcessImpl.java:597)
        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ProcessImpl.launch(ProcessImpl.java:131)
        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.TIDelegateHelper.launchProcess(TIDelegateHelper.java:495)
        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.TIDelegateHelper.launch(TIDelegateHelper.java:309)

        at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.internal.launcher.core.LauncherUtility.delegateInit(LauncherUtility.java:1134)

Guru, can we fix this in 4.4?
This is a simple fix and ought to be fixed in 4.4

I made mistake in description. 
5. should be the following
go to "Monitor" page and click "Test Availability" for "Java profiling - JRE 1.5 or newer".

Seems that problem is in misconfiguration of IAC and profiler agents
all following configuration files are empty (but for windows they proper configured)
eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.runtime_4.4.0.v200706070100/config/pluginconfig.xml
eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.ac.linux_ia32_4.4.0.v200706020100/agent_controller/config/serviceconfig.xml
eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.ac.linux_em64t_4.4.0.v200706020100/agent_controller/config/serviceconfig.xml
eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.ac.linux_ipf_4.4.0.v200706020100/agent_controller/config/serviceconfig.xml

Following three I've included for nothing, they should be configured at first run
(In reply to comment #5)
> eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.ac.linux_ia32_4.4.0.v200706020100/agent_controller/config/serviceconfig.xml
> eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.ac.linux_em64t_4.4.0.v200706020100/agent_controller/config/serviceconfig.xml
> eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.ac.linux_ipf_4.4.0.v200706020100/agent_controller/config/serviceconfig.xml
> 

but the first (eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.runtime_4.4.0.v200706070100/config/pluginconfig.xml) stills empty after first run
Igor, would you please look into this defect?
Changing name of the defect

This patch doesn't solve problem in my case. 
File "eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.runtime_4.4.0.v200706070100\config\pluginconfig.xml" remains empty after open "Profile Dialog".

To check this patch I've just created new config.jar with patched class and put it in eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.runtime_4.4.0.v200706070100. After that, I run eclipse and tried profiling.

Seems that path solves only part of problem, it corrects parameter value in pluginconfig.xml, but I see that nothing at all has been written in pluginconfig.xml.

The patch creates new pluginconfig.xml for my installation.
What jvm and os are you using?

It is tested at
